intro: Koilodepas longifolium, commonly known as the long-leaved koilodepas, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araceae, which includes many aquatic and semi-aquatic plants. The plant is characterized by its long, slender leaves that can grow up to several meters in length. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in an inflorescence called a spadix, typical of the Araceae family. Koilodepas longifolium is often found in wetland habitats and is adapted to thrive in moist, swampy environments.
